p: The genus Lippia comprises 150 species, most of which are distributed in the Neotropical ecozone [ 1]. Brazil stands out as the centre of diversity of the genus with 98 species presenting high degrees of endemism. More than half of these species are concentrated in the Espinhaço Range, which stretches 1000 km through the Brazilian states of Minas Gerais and Bahia [ 2]. However, 18 species are considered rare or endangered, and nine are under threat of extinction due to the destruction of their natural environments in the Cerrado region (Brazilian type of Savana) [ 3].
